title: Inner Radical
text: You can start of by simplifying the inner radical.
speech: You can start of by simplifying the inner radical.
pacedSpeech: You can start of by simplifying the inner radical.

title: Principal Square Root

subHints.title: Principal Square Root
subHints.text: The principal square root of a is the nonnegative number that, when multiplied by itself, equals a. It is written as a radical expression, with a symbol called a radical over the term called the radicand: $$\sqrt{a}$$.

subHints.title: Principal Square Root
subHints.text: What number multiplied by itself equals 16?

speech: What is  the square root of 16 ?
pacedSpeech: What is   the square root of 16

title: Inner Radical
speech: Simlify the expression:  the square root of the square root of 16, end root is equal to the square root of 4
pacedSpeech: Simlify the expression:   the square root of the square root of 16, end root is equal to the square root of 4

title: Principal Square Root
